title: How to Wear an Off the Shoulder Dress

steps.title: A strapless bra provides support without being visible.
steps.content: A strapless bra provides support without being visible. Plus, there are lots of styles and varieties to choose from! Instead of battling traditional bra straps, try a classic strapless or bandeau bra instead. Adhesive and backless bras also offer a lot of flexibility and freedom. [1] X Research source If your off-the-shoulder dress has a plunging neckline, a plunge or short line bra might be a good option. Body tape is another handy choice if you’re in a pinch.

steps.title: Both short and long boots work great with an off-the-shoulder dress.
steps.content: Both short and long boots work great with an off-the-shoulder dress. Complement a shorter dress with long, over-the-knee boots for a chic, elegant look. For a casual, streetwise outfit, slip into a pair of ankle booties instead. [2] X Research source For instance, you could slip a sweater and jacket over your off-the-shoulder dress, and then finish off the look with a set of ankle boots. To brave the chillier weather, you might wear a turtleneck and gilet over your dress, and then slip into a knee-high pair of boots.

steps.title: Sandals look great with lots of different dresses.
steps.content: Sandals look great with lots of different dresses. Off-the-shoulder dresses are an especially excellent choice for warm, sunny weather. Go for a casual look with a pair of slip-on sandals, or try on a set of gladiator sandals. High-heeled sandals and wedges are other great choices if you’re aiming to dress up.

steps.title: Flat shoes are the perfect choice for a quick, on-the-go look.
steps.content: Flat shoes are the perfect choice for a quick, on-the-go look. Look through your closet for a spare pair of ballet flats—these add an elegant but casual touch to your outfit. [3] X Research source For an even more relaxed look, slip into a pair of slides before popping out on an errand. Even tennis shoes can look good with an off-the-shoulder dress! [4] X Research source

steps.title: All kinds of heels work well with an off-the-shoulder dress.
steps.content: All kinds of heels work well with an off-the-shoulder dress. Keep it classic with a pair of low pumps, or go for a breezier look with a set of strappy, open-toed heels. Chunky, high-heeled sandals are another great option for your outfit. [5] X Research source

steps.title: This homemade contraption will keep your dress sleeves from riding up.
steps.content: This homemade contraption will keep your dress sleeves from riding up. Unfasten 2 safety pins and thread a hair tie onto both of the open pins—this creates a mini bungee cord. Secure the bungee along the inner elastic seam of your dress, directly in front of where your armpit would go. Then, pin it to the opposite side of the seam. Repeat this process along the opposite side of your dress to keep the sleeves from climbing up your shoulders! [6] X Research source Attach these homemade bungee cords before slipping into the dress.

steps.title: Choker-style necklaces help keep the focus on your dress.
steps.content: Choker-style necklaces help keep the focus on your dress. Off-the-shoulder dresses don’t mesh super well with heavy, chunky jewelry. Go for a light, casual choker to finish off your look instead. [7] X Research source Pendant-style necklaces are also a great option.

steps.title: Small bags complement your outfit without being over-the-top.
steps.content: Small bags complement your outfit without being over-the-top. Look for any clutch, handbag, or other small bag that you can comfortably carry in 1 hand. For extra style points, grab a bag that matches your dress’s color scheme. For instance, you might pair a white dress with a multicolored handbag.

steps.title: Layers turn your dress into the perfect winter outfit.
steps.content: Layers turn your dress into the perfect winter outfit. Slide into a pair of tights, along with a comfy turtleneck. Then, layer favorite off-the-shoulder dress overtop. [8] X Research source If you don’t have a spare turtleneck lying around, grab a sweater instead.

steps.title: This outfit is perfect for a chilly day.
steps.content: This outfit is perfect for a chilly day. Slip into your favorite off-the-shoulder dress, layering a long-sleeved sweatshirt on top. Then, pull a thick winter jacket on as a final touch. [9] X Research source Long, thigh-high boots work great with this look.

steps.title: Turn your dress into a tasteful tunic.
steps.content: Turn your dress into a tasteful tunic. Grab your favorite off-the-shoulder dress, along with a comfortable pair of pants or leggings. Instead of treating your dress as its own outfit, wear it as a stylish shirt instead. [10] X Research source For instance, you might layer your dress over a pair of warm leggings, or create a casual look with a pair of skinny jeans.

steps.title: This style works great with a long-sleeved dress.
steps.content: This style works great with a long-sleeved dress. Slip an arm into 1 of the sleeves, pulling the fabric up and over your shoulder. Then, pull the empty sleeve behind your back. Secure your dress with a belt and tuck the sleeve in the back. [11] X Research source

steps.title: This is a great way to protect your shoulders and arms from the sun.
steps.content: This is a great way to protect your shoulders and arms from the sun. Simply pull the garment up and over both shoulders, so it looks like a traditional dress. [12] X Research source If your dress seems a little short afterward, slip on a pair of shorts or leggings underneath for extra security.

steps.title: Loop the sleeves around your neck instead of wearing them on your arms.
steps.content: Loop the sleeves around your neck instead of wearing them on your arms. Slip into your dress, leaving the arm holes completely empty. Twist the sleeves together along the base of your neck. Then, tie the 2 sleeve ends together around the back of your neck using a short length of ribbon. [13] X Research source You can also make your dress completely strapless by wrapping and tucking the empty dress sleeves into a cinched waist belt.
